pros: DEALERTRACK IS VERY USER FRIENDLY AND I LIKE ALL THE REFERENCE MATERIAL AVAILABLE.
cons: I DO NOT LIKE THE FACT THAT IS SOME REPORTING YOU CAN'T REFERENCE TWO YEARS TOGETHER.  YOU HAVE TO PRINT EACH YEAR SEPARATELY.
title: DEALERTRACK

pros: I enjoyed being able to long on anywhere to underwrite deals.  It also made pulling reports and entering new dealers easy.
cons: I did not like when I could not get a dealer to “line up”. Most of the time they lined up perfect, but sometimes it would take too long.
title: Dealertrack Made My Job Easier

pros: When it is up and running it is useful and would be great, the idea of what it can do is exactly what you would want.   If I want to see the service history from the last year I couldn't get all the information I needed.  Not sure if this is because we didn't have the software integrated correctly or what.
cons: Had problems logging on in the morning when I first got to work.  The Vin scanner doesn't always read on the first try, have to scan and scan to get it to read.    The mobile application just didn't work fast enough.  I often had to go back to my desk to get all the data I needed and by then it was too late to capitalized on the initial  interaction with the customer.
title: When it works it is acceptable.

pros: They consistently stay up to date and on top of their platform.
cons: Does not show ltv and other things while submitting  like some competitors.
title: DealerTrack is a must!

pros: >Overall Cost is the normal variable in choosing the DealerTrack DMS *Cheaper Dealer solution than either CDK or Reynolds &Reynolds  >Some Aspects of the DMS can be Automated even though the overall solution is FTP based.  >Navigation is not too intensive  >Able to set up Auto run extractions for provision to a CRM Solution  >Setup of reporting and or File runs is normally easily accomplished  >Offers In house Integration with Service App X-Time
cons: >Reporting is not as extensive as offered by other DMS providers  >X-Time integration can be spotty at times  >Limitations on the amount of Historical data that is maintained within the DMS, remaining Data is archived and is not as easily accessible.  >System is not Live update for Automated reporting *Example: Automated reports set up today do not get recognized by the system as such until the nightly update occurs.   >Seems to be fewer people available at a dealership that possess the proper admin access required for setting up reports or reviewing High end information.
title: Dealer Track - Affordable DMS solution

pros: Dealer track has a tool for almost every need in the industry. Very easy to use. Always Improving and adding valuable tools.
cons: Cost should be tailored to dealership size and use of product. Not to take away from its value because there is no better tool for the automobile industry.
title: Dealer Track best software in the Automotive industry

pros: Allowes me to view multiple finance companies at a press of a button.  Gives you information on additional documents that are needed.  Quick information upload
cons: The cons for me is that it allowed other F&I users to see qualified and minimal qualified candidates.  This did create issues with cherry picking.
title: At your finger tips!

pros: Entering inventory is easy. Connecting to our site is easy.
cons: Design and layout of some features is not easy, visually appealing.
title: Dealertrack could be easier

pros: Easy to use.  Has more current features after converting from Reynolds and Reynolds.  Way cheaper as well.
cons: Seems to be lacking some features that are present in other areas of the software.  Suggestions need to have at least 50 votes before Dealertrack will even look at it.
title: Mostly Happy with Dealer track.

pros: It allows me to accomplish most of my daily tasks without much headache
cons: The user interface isn't great. It could be so much better. Some parameters should be automatic. In the forms section the scroll function is weird and everything seems very old school.
title: Good tool but not great

pros: I love to be able to access the different financial institutes for payoffs, you cant image how much time this saves.
cons: I would love it if more banks signed up with them. It gives you easy access without ever having to pick up the telephone and hold on for 20 minutes.
title: Very easy to manuver

pros: Dealertrack DMS was easy to use and integrated well with the web provider that we used at the time.
cons: The accounting side seemed very antiquated and was not easy to pull monthly reports
title: Great for inventory management

pros: It's easy to use and keeps track of inventory and leads in a comprehensive manner.  You can make as many quotes as you need.
cons: I wish the font and colors were darker because we have a hard time seeing the screen sometimes.  Great product though.
title: I use this everyday and it's great!

pros: The product caters around the auto industry in all ways.  It's consistently getting better by the day.
cons: Certain software glitches with all the new additions they have been making. The problem is dealing with the IT support in India.
title: Great company with great products and people

pros: It's integration with the best software and your key to all available lenders. They already have generated standardized forms so there are no times you'll need to reinvent the wheel
cons: Price, but you can only have two or is the criteria. If it's good and fast, it's not cheap. If it's fast and cheap, it's not good. And if it's cheap and good, it's not fast. Pick two.
title: The center of your business

pros: Easy of use. Organized. Easy to visually look at inventory. Feeds data to various websites with minimal hiccups and reliable.
cons: User interface is somewhat outdated and needs a fresh look. Easier ways to search for inventory.
title: Must have

pros: Cheap alternative to the big dogs (ADP, REYNOLDS, ect)
cons: System is always going down and running slow. Ridiculous to run a business this way.
title: System Down AGAIN!!

pros: Easy of use. Simply and easy. I like it because it’s a self taught product.
cons: Nothing really negative to say. It’s a easy product to use.
title: Great product!

pros: I love that Dealertrack is user friendly. I can sort by current applications, contracts in transit and user.
cons: There have not been any features that I have had issues with when using Dealertrack software so far.
title: Dealertrack keeps our F&I process streamlined

pros: Cox is making progress is turning Arkona into a friendlier DMS.
cons: Its Arkona and it still needs some help, however we can see Cox working on it.
title: Cox is making progress

pros: Great way to submit and structure deals and easily imports other deals
cons: Crm is terrible and way over priced, credit pulls too
title: Expensive but great

pros: simplicity
cons: na
title: dealership simplified

pros: Simple to use and train new staff on
cons: I wish the working area of the screen were bigger and maximized the whole length of your monitor
title: Super easy and inexpensive

pros: As an IT professional, I support many dealerships and they all run Dealertrack.  Their customer support is top notch and any issues get resolved after one phone call.
cons: I do not have any cons for Dealertrack.  The honestly are the best around
title: Great software for all dealerships

pros: -Very easy to find new lenders for sub-prime financing -Works very well with wayne reaves  -The application process for submitting customers info to finance companies is seamless -Easy to submit applications to multiple lenders
cons: -Has a bit of a learning curve -The website should have a walkthrough for new users to learn the platform Nothing other than those 2 i've noticed
title: The one and only solution for financing

pros: The software offers a true variety of options when it comes to daily operations. The team at Dealertrack is always on top of updates and communication and the system rarely if ever has any issues.
cons: There aren't many cons from my standpoint, it provides a tool to help get things done in an efficient manner. The only issue you may run into is when you have people setting up others accounts, they can either give too much or too little to the user in terms of options. I would advise training the HR or whomever you will have set the program up to be very specific to each persons roll in the company, again this is a user issue not the program itself
title: Dealertrack DMS

pros: It makes it easier to receive the credit applications from clients digitally verses over the phone.
cons: The credit application form allows clients to leave out important information that’s needed for a credit decision from a bank which means we have to call and get the information. At that point we might as well just get the whole thing over the phone. Also, the number of users allowed access to the program causes problems for being able to pull the info late at night when the people are gone for the day.
title: Credit Apps

pros: After the initial learning curve, things are pretty straight forward. The thing I like most is being able to streamline processes in our company that used to take up infinitely more time than they do now.
cons: Some features that can be approved on is menu placement for shortcuts when working within workflows. Also being able to edit tickets that have been booked and make amends if need be.
title: Service Writing

pros: I love how diverse the functionality of Dealertrack, from tracking employee activity to streamlining processes this is a tremendously helpful tool
cons: Dealertrack has "married" with so many other systems, we have long term employees with multi-profiles as a result.  It would be great if there was an automated process to merge the systems to create a better user experience as the platform expands.
title: User Friendly Business Softwarw

pros: It is point and click, very easy to use. Everyone can be proficient from day one
cons: Has an occasional gremlin where a trade in will show up sold to the customer who murchased
title: Switched from Reynolds

pros: Before Dealertrack, trying to get credit applications over to banks was a tedious and monotonous process in which created a lot of tension for customers. The reason? Because to wait for a disposition for a customer could take quite some time. Enter Dealertrack! With Dealertrack, getting approvals was quick and easy.
cons: Nothing to report. During the time that I used it, I don't ever recall having any issues or having to call them up for either training or technical support. This is a true testament to how easy their software is to use.
title: The Gold standard

pros: Very diverse DMS for the money. Switched from one of the other big three to Dealertrack and after we got our feet wet, you couldn’t make anyone go back.
cons: Need to ensure you take this rare time to start fresh and clean up your accounting and processes. No sense in bringing the old ways to the new set up (and typically you don’t switch a DMS often). We, unfortunately, did not do our due diligence and the implementation folks are going to do what you ask- which was foolish on our part. Because of that we had a few months after where it was not as smooth as I would have liked
title: Customizable and Easy to use

pros: Absolutely NOTHING, the ONLY thing this update did was get me to look into RouteOne!
cons: There is absolutely nothing i like about it, WHY would you change something that wasn't broken and user friendly? I don't get it, so i will be looking into other options!
title: Tragic update

pros: ease of use,  information available anytime at my fingertips,.  Loved the ability to communicate with lenders directly from site. ability to save and store deals.  all compliance material available at your fingertips.
cons: a little difficult to move from one deal to another without saving information first, but overall I am well satisfied with product
title: great program for a smaller company

pros: It is very easy to train employees to use and is esthetically appealing. Also, its integration with other products, specifically its DMS, is second to none.
cons: It is limited. You have to pay for everything. It has limited internal capabilities. Very expensive. No captive has partnered with them to mitigate said costs.
title: Second Best of Lender Submission Platforms

pros: I like using dealertrack.  As a F&I manager at an automotive dealership, I use Dealertrack to submit all of my credit applications and it is so easy to use!  I can access payoffs, approvals, and everything in between with Dealertrack.
cons: Every so often, the software goes down and it can take minutes or hours for it to come back.  I also wish there was a way to transfer my credit apps into my Lot Wizard instead of having to re-type everything.
title: Great software for the automotive industry

pros: The shortcut key options to create a deal or add a new line to a work order were the best for saving time, especially when creating multiple sales for the same fleet customer, or multiple PDI work orders.
cons: The accounting integration could have been improved to incorporate accessory sales and gross profits. We would have to add accessories and manually calculate the gross profit on the sale and installation.
title: DealerTrack DMS was the best DMS we have ever used...until it was no longer available in Canada

pros: Their customer support for troubleshooting with printers can be great.  When you get a truly qualified support specialist, they really take the time to make sure your issue is resolved.
cons: Unfortunately when their customer support is lacking knowledge or wiliness to take the time to listen it can put a sour taste in your mouth.
title: Customer Support for Printers - Hit or Miss

pros: I like the software, very easy to use, easy to set up and also easy to train my employees on how to use the software.
cons: The one con I would say Dealertrack has, which it hasn't happened for awhile now, is that the website will go down and we can't use the software until the website comes back online.
title: Best Automotive DMS

pros: I love that Dealertrack integrates with my other DMS software and I can seamlessly send apps to all of my chosen lenders. Counter offers are made right there and all within minutes. It shortens the car buying process for customers and F&I.
cons: There is a little bit of a learning curve when you first start. But the staff is very helpful and will help you get the most out of the system.
title: I love being able to have all my lenders in one place!

pros: I like the ease of the General Ledger side of Dealertrack. For me, it works pretty well and is easy to navigate.
cons: I wish the stocking in of parts would translate into processing an invoice easier.
title: Functional for us

pros: Uptodate tech. Great source of options. Dealertrack as a company is very productive in their operations.
cons: Regarding the child company Dealer.com: Customer support has many breaks in communication between support reps and techs. The background coding environment used antiquated code. It takes way to long to resolve minor issues. Promises are often made yet are not fulfilled.
title: Dealertrack is one of the leading full auto dealer solutions companies.

pros: I used dealertrack as a receptionist for a car dealership for about a year.  Once you know where everything is and what numbers and info to put where, it's a really easy program to use for a dealership needs. I was able to get fast and get salesmen and managers reports they needed very quickly!
cons: This program looks very dated. It's also almost impossible to find things on your own. I went through a couple days of training to learn how to navigate the software and for the next few weeks I had to reference cheat sheets I had made or ask questions.
title: Didn't love, didn't hate it.

pros: This product is very easy to use, which ultimately makes my job easier. Their customer service is very helpful as well
cons: There have been several times my leads have gotten "stuck" and i have had to call to get them taken care of. It doesn't happen often.
title: Great Product

pros: Inputting info easy to do, communication with lenders is good.
cons: Going in between multiple applications with one customer, navigation is redundant finding forms and lenders is not user friendly
title: Good but a little hard to navigate

pros: The interface is very sleek and easy to use, I love it and hope the company never switches over to another software
cons: There isn't too much I don't like about this software, It's slow at times, But that could very well be out internet.
title: Usage

pros: Widely used in Auto industry, same parent company as various other softwares important in the automotive sector.
cons: Very antiquated interface and apparently no intention to upgrade. Printer set up is like the davinci code.  Customer support is terrible.  Not designed for an independent dealer, only OEM's.
title: Dont Do It

pros: I love how easy Dealertrack DMS is for our used car lot. We use it daily to track our inventory and submit finance deals through outside lenders. The documents provided are very helpful for our business as well. Its very easy to learn!
cons: Nothing that I do not like about Dealertrack DMS
title: Best DMS I've Used!

pros: The direct access it gives to multiple lenders.
cons: Sometimes the deals get stuck between me and another lender and I have to call to get it pushed through.
title: Dealertrack is a great system for pulling bureaus and accessing lenders!

pros: I like that I have become accustomed to all of the features and its ease of use. Being a daily user I need something that functions properly so I can work efficiently.
cons: Sometimes the software can crash with some regularity.
title: Dealertrack, good but some faults

pros: Dealertrack DMS is very easy to use, as well has great helpful customer service as well as superior hospitality.

pros: I use this daily in my work and it helps me with internet sales. Can track customers and work my leads easily.

title: DealerTrack DMS

pros: Finance finance finance! You need a way to submit your deals, the old school sending customers to the bank themselves doesn’t work anymore.
cons: The wait time to get signed up. Customer service could be much better.
title: If you’re new in the business, this is the most simple software and best bang for your buck there is

pros: The ease of navigating the system is wonderful.

title: Easy to use, fast results.

pros: User Friendly.  360 Help Button. Multi Functional  Report variety & options are second to none

title: Dealertrack DMS will not disapoint.

pros: Using this DMS software daily has been a little bit of a steep learning curve after so many years with Reynolds & Reynolds but as the time goes on it becomes more and more intuitive on a day to day basis. It seems they continue to run updates and improve the experience as well.
cons: Would have liked some more in depth training related to those that are computer savvy, there are a number of shortcuts that come in hand that we've had to learn ourselves that make using this DMS worlds more simple. Maybe consider adding this into the training program going forward.
title: New DMS, works well

pros: What I like most is you can submit credit applications for potential car buys and do all the financing paper work all on the same software.
cons: What I like least about the software is sometimes it does crash and you have to call technical support.
title: Efficient

pros: it sends all the information needed to several financial institutions therefor saving us time and money.

title: easy to use

pros: Easy to use for our business office managers and our office staff. Great program that helps track incentives.
cons: Cost is a little higher than others but we dont mind paying a little extra to get such a great and easy to use product
title: Great DMS

pros: Their customer service is not the best but it is above average. My company integrates with DealerTrack and their support staff is superb.  Their website is very organized and the interface makes it easy to navigate.
cons: The only con I have ran into is that their website on works on Internet Explorer and can not be accessed through Google Chrome without an extension.
title: My company is integrated with Dealertrack

pros: Great for utilizing your customers information for a deal structure, pulling credit and expediting your deal to all the Banks and Credit Unions you use for approvals.
cons: Unfortunately, not all Banks or Credit Unions use the Dealer Track platform.  And you have to be established with a Bank or Credit Union to expedite a deal to.  It would be nice if the system had Financial Institutes on their platform to help out Independent Dealers.
title: Dealer Track is an excellent CRM tool to have when your preparing a new deal for financing structure

pros: Super easy to use especially for uploaded deals and stips

title: Dealertrack DMS

pros: Very easy to use and makes my job easier. Customer service is great and very helpful. Would recommend.

pros: Reasonable rate, Great DMS, better than any I have used

title: Great DMS Service

pros: At our dealership, the parts department and service department really like the software. Creating repair orders and parts tickets are pretty easy and straightforward. Customer support is also good when you need assistance. The vehicle sales side of things takes many more steps than it should, but it certainly gets the job done in the long run.
cons: As this is a cloud-based solution, there are occasional outages with the data center. When this happens, our entire business is impacted since it runs every aspect of it.
title: Overall decent software, but lacking in some areas

pros: Dealertrack keeps hundreds of customers organized. Making it easy to get the information needed quickly. Also keeps each employee with different schedules informed on the progress of each customer so everyone is informed and has the correct information. Also keeps a record of  each customer, loan information and lender information all in one place.
cons: There isn't much that I don't like about the software. I know it does a lot more than I even use it for. If I have to give a con the only thing I can think of is that the password needs to be changed often and when using multiple programs and software it gets annoying to change all the passwords so frequently but that's just a small thing that takes an extra 30 seconds.
title: Dealertrack

pros: I can get my credit report and submit credit app all in same place!  Multiple options for lenders in one site!
cons: It can get confusing if you're not trained how to input the taxes and extra fees.
title: Dealertrack works great!

pros: I used Dealertrack at a Ford Dealership as Service Writer and found it easy to operate and navigate.
cons: A glitch in the system prevented codes to be properly read.  Found out later that it needed a software update, which fixed the problem.
title: The better choice.

pros: It links well with our banks and is easy to track deals from start to finish.

pros: Easy to use, secure. Good for anyone in the office to use.

pros: User friendly interface.

pros: Easy to use.

pros: Financing can be complicated, but this makes the whole process very simple.
